results.title: Trump Plan to Sell Arctic Oil Leases Will Face Challenges
results.abstract: If lease sales happen in the final days of the Trump administration, they may face disputes in court or could be reversed by the Biden administration.
results.byline: By Henry Fountain and John Schwartz

results.title: Biden Plans to Move Fast With a ‘Climate Administration.’ Here’s How.
results.abstract: President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. will embed climate policy throughout his government, not only in environmental agencies but in departments like justice, defense, the Treasury and transportation.
results.byline: By Coral Davenport and Lisa Friedman

results.title: Masatoshi Koshiba, 94, Dies; Nobel Winner Tracked Ghostly Neutrinos
results.abstract: A physics teacher had flunked him, denigrating his abilities. Dr. Koshiba set out to prove the teacher was wrong.

results.title: Dr. Céline Gounder, Adviser to Biden, on the Next Covid Attack Plan
results.abstract: Schools are essential while restaurants are not, said Dr. Gounder. And manufacturers may soon be ordered to produce protective gear for health workers.

results.title: Albert R. Jonsen, 89, Dies; Brought Medical Ethics to the Bedside
results.abstract: A former Jesuit priest and leader in bioethics, he believed that an ethicist should be part of a patient’s medical team when hard decisions have to be made.

multimedia.caption: Dr. Albert R. Jonsen in an undated photo. “He was a sage,” one colleague said. “There was no bottom to that well of knowledge.”

results.title: States Vow Extra Scrutiny of Coronavirus Vaccine
results.abstract: Special committees, mostly in Democratic-led states, will seek to reassure the public that an F.D.A.-approved vaccine is safe and effective amid doubts about the Trump administration’s virus response.
results.byline: By Ellen Gabler and Abby Goodnough
org_facet: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

results.title: Japanese ‘Monster Wolf’ Aims to Scare Off Wild Bears
results.abstract: After bears kept venturing into the city in search of food, officials installed mechanical wolves with bared teeth, glowing red eyes and a fearsome screech to keep the animals away.

results.abstract: NASA, which has worked to spotlight the “hidden figures” in its history, but has so far sent only 14 Black Americans to space.

Doctors Are Calling It Quits Under Stress of the Pandemic
results.abstract: Thousands of medical practices are closing, as doctors and nurses decide to retire early or shift to less intense jobs.

results.title: Take the Edge Off With Video Games
results.abstract: Unlike loud, stress-inducing shoot-’em-ups, these ones are meant to calm the mind and offer moments of quiet and clarity.

results.title: Missing From State Plans to Distribute the Coronavirus Vaccine: Money to Do It
results.abstract: The government has sent billions to drug companies to develop a coronavirus shot but a tiny fraction of that to localities for training, record-keeping and other costs for vaccinating citizens.
results.byline: By Abby Goodnough and Sheila Kaplan
org_facet: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

multimedia.caption: Cars lining up for Covid-19 tests at Dodger Stadium in Los Angeles this summer. Delivering a vaccine to Americans will present even more logistical and political challenges.

results.abstract: You can still connect with loved ones near and far with a holiday card, and referencing the pandemic is OK. Just be mindful of your tone.

results.title: Biden Wants to Be the Climate President. He’ll Need Some Help From Xi Jinping.
